div.p: Systematized Nomenclature of Dentistry (SNODENT) is owned, maintained and distributed by the American Dental Association (ADA). SNODENT is a vocabulary designed for use in the electronic environment - for electronic health and dental records. The intended purpose is to:

ul.li: Provide standardized terms for describing dental disease
Capture clinical detail and patient characteristics
Permit analysis of patient care services and outcomes
To be interoperable with Electronic Health Records (EHR) and Electronic Dental Records (EDR)

div.p: SNODENT licensing information can be found at: http://www.ada.org/8466.aspx

description.value: Systematized Nomenclature of Dentistry (SNODENT) is owned, maintained and distributed by the American Dental Association (ADA). SNODENT is a vocabulary designed for use in the electronic environment - for electronic health and dental records. The intended purpose is to: Provide standardized terms for describing dental disease Capture clinical detail and patient characteristics Permit analysis of patient care services and outcomes To be interoperable with Electronic Health Records (EHR) and Electronic Dental Records (EDR) SNODENT licensing information can be found at: http://www.ada.org/8466.aspx URL for Official Source: http://www.ada.org/snodent.aspx

display.value: Lingual Surface

definition.value: The lingual aspect of the tooth.

display.value: Buccal Surface

definition.value: The buccal aspect of the tooth.

display.value: Tooth mobility - grade 1

definition.value: Tooth can be moved less than 1mm in the buccolingual or mesiodistal direction

display.value: Mesial Surface

definition.value: The mesial aspect of the tooth.

display.value: Tooth mobility - grade 2

definition.value: Tooth can be moved 1mm or more in the buccolingual or mesiodistal direction. No mobility in the occlusoapical direction (vertical mobility).

display.value: Facial surface of tooth

definition.value: The side of a tooth adjacent to the inside of the cheek or lips.

display.value: Distal Surface

definition.value: The distal aspect of the tooth.

display.value: Tooth mobility - grade 3

definition.value: Tooth can be moved 1mm or more in the buccolingual or mesiodistal direction. Mobility in the occlusoapical direction is also present (vertical mobility)

The mesial lingual aspect of the tooth.
The distal lingual aspect of the tooth.
The distal buccal aspect of the tooth.
The mesial buccal aspect of the tooth.

display.value: Lower labial frenum

definition.value: The folds of mucous membrane extending from the gingiva to the midline of the lower lip.

display.value: Upper labial frenum

definition.value: The folds of mucous membrane extending from the gingiva to the midline of the upper lip.

display.value: Upper buccal frenum

definition.value: A fold or band of mucous membrane connecting the upper alveolar ridge to the cheek and separating the labial vestibule from the buccal vestibule

display.value: Lower buccal frenum

definition.value: A fold or band of mucous membrane connecting the lower alveolar ridge to the cheek and separating the labial vestibule from the buccal vestibule
